alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lee, northeastern Clarendon and central Sumter Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Sumter County Airport to near Woods Bay State Park. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Manning, South Sumter, Mulberry, Alcolu, Woods Bay State Park, Turbeville, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Oswego, Brogdon, East Sumter, St. Charles, Gable, Shiloh and Lakewood. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 120 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
